comments.body: Maybe nerf the cloud and need you to have gold armor? and make the netherith ingot trade into netherith scrap so it isn't so OP
hmm...... instreting
There could be a way for the Elder Piglin to take you inside of a Bastion without Piglin Brutes attacking you.

I've recently suggested an idea for piglins putting gold from bartering into chests, and perhaps this could be incorporated here. The piglins could raid each other's chests for the gold, and move it back to their bastion. Food could apply to this, as well. I like this a lot, as it would function much like villagers gossiping/job blocks in adding new life to places in the world.
Cool Idea. But if the difficulty went up in the whole of the world this addition will not work anymore. good for beginners in easy mode, but pros will likely not use this.

I believe the exiled should resemble endermen in some way as they also somewhat resemble human beings. I think they should have an option in their trading menu to travel with the player like a companion. You could have them as a teammate, helping you battle mobs like a dog would. You could also bring them to another exiled and they would instantly interact and one of them would drop a block that acts like a bell would in a village and they would continue talk with each other as it would've been a long time since they've seen another one of their kind. Then, the one you brought with you would be bound to the same job site block and would stay together in the same hut and maybe start a family. You could then place down more job site blocks and bring another couple of exiled to the town and they would be bound to the new job station as well. Being able to reunite the exiled would be nice because they wouldn't be lonely anymore and it would provide a happy ending for them. There could also a reward for reuniting them to give incentive to the player to reunite them.
why not
Plz i would love that

It would be better if Lich(es) would be a mini-boss in nether.

Never the less, Lich(es) could summon and control undead(obviously). Those undead would patrol(the area), raid (maybe some other faction in nether if there was ever one) and guard the Lich.

I wouldn't mind Liches being a mini boss. I think that it would be nice to make the Nether more diverse and interesting.

They're supposed to be hard and something you don't tackle until you have some decent gear and skill at the game.  You can also use technique to make the battles easier like using bows or pillaring up two blocks before taking on a vindicator.

I actually think they should be more powerful.  Evokers should be a boss that is at least as powerful and hard to defeat as the wither, and only one should spawn in each mansion.  They should be resummonable, and vindicators should continually spawn there and be a lot more common.  They should also move very quickly and be able to kill a player in unenchanted diamond armor in one or two hits (on hard mode anyway, on normal mode they should be a lot weaker.)

 

Sometime I'll make an official suggestion for this.
Umm I took out an entire woodland mansion with a chain chestplate and a stone sword. Illagers are too weak
they're supposed to be a challenge. I will admit, they are annoying (especially vexes) but if you go deal with them that's your own choice. if you do you just have to make sure you have good gear

Please I would like cherry blossom village so maybe we could have some cool structures from maybe idk Japan one of those like villages and maybe if it comes out in a update then you could add some new blocks to go go with it PLEASE and if it gets added thank you
Ok thats a great idea,and perfect with my archer villager idea,the medic could heal them

If you really wanna pitch this, maybe add some other trade options. A saw block for wood is a good idea, the carpenter too, but what does this villager offer that isn't already easy to get? You've mentioned novice trades, but what about others? Maybe at mid-levels, it offers doors and other such decorative blocks, and at expert and master, it could offer enchanted axes and maybe jukeboxes? They're wooden and, so far, the only craftable diamond item not attainable through villagers.

Joiner. Yes, they can manufacture and sell bowls, BARRELS, various DOORS and hatches, gates, signs, steps = benches = roofs. He can buy wood that is rare in his biome or common (Nether wood is expensive). He can buy AX and WAX. He may also need a lot of sunflowers (for oil). He can sell boats (resell to a fisherman) and chests.
At the last stage, he can sell the "Tree" flag pattern.
yes this is a very good idea

Also villagers with names!
I like the idea of giving each village its own identity, but there's precedent that would need to broken here. As far as I am aware, no generated structures contain human text.
I agree with noodle, and that would be too much work for a painful outcome because then it would be weird to name tag villagers
I like small things like this that add the the game

Small side suggestion: How that could work spawning in they could spawn out of render distance, or at least 50 blocks away, so you encounter them already moving along realistically, above y=50, and only in some biomes like plains, the open varients of Forests, Deserts, and Savannahs, and away from Villages. That way it can't happen anywhere for an advantage/getting stuck (Like underground, in the ocean, or in a Dark Oak Forest) 

Being Biome specific would also make it much more unique, unlike the Wandering Traveler, meaning if you're always in a Mountain Biome, the Pillager Caravan won't spawn in the Mountain Biome.
I like this idea as it explains how illagers maintain their population. Perhaps there would be a weak iron golem in the caravan that can't attack .

My idea is a little different, but similar enough to post it here. So, as we already know pillagers don't attack baby villagers. My idea is that in about 10% of pillager patrols there is baby villager on a lead. The baby villager would follow the pillager with a banner. It basically means that pillages kidnaps children and train them to be pillagers. Player have the choice to rescue baby villager, and when it grow up and have a job there will be discount waiting.
This idea is just what we need for villages . and player bases
